simplified: Now NASA is working to find and record smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 metres wide or bigger. Scientists think there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. NASA has found and recorded about 8,000 of them. This means 17,000 asteroids are still missing. In 2013, a small 19-metre asteroid exploded above a city called Chelyabinsk in Russia. It hurt 1,200 people. These middle-sized asteroids would be very dangerous if they come close to Earth.

Complex Document: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: Now NASA is working to find and record smaller asteroids. These asteroids are 140 metres wide or bigger. Scientists think there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. NASA has found and recorded about 8,000 of them. This means 17,000 asteroids are still missing. In 2013, a small 19-metre asteroid exploded above a city called Chelyabinsk in Russia. It hurt 1,200 people. These middle-sized asteroids would be very dangerous if they come close to Earth.

simplified: The Hunger Games happen every year. The Capitol makes this event to show the districts they are still being punished for fighting against them long ago. Each year, one boy and one girl between 12 and 18 years old are picked from each district. Their names are chosen by chance, like a lottery. These young people must fight each other until only one person is still alive. The teenagers who are chosen are called "tributes". Everyone in the country must watch this on TV.

simplified: Small animals like birds, mice and insects live in many cities and towns. We see them every day. But now, bigger wild animals are coming to cities too. There are more and more of them. Do people like them? Or do people think they are dangerous?

simplified: 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are space rocks. They can come very close to Earth - within 7.5 million kilometres. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these dangerous rocks. NASA thinks none of them will hit Earth in the next 100 years. NASA can watch these rocks with special technology. They can guess if the rocks might hit Earth. If there is danger, NASA has two ways to protect Earth.

Complex Document: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.

If there is danger, NASA has two ways to protect Earth.

simplified: One night in 2003, Suzanne Collins was changing TV channels. At that time, the US was fighting a war in Iraq. She could only find two types of TV shows. One type was reality shows with young people trying to win a million dollars. The other type was news shows about the war. Suzanne saw both shows and they mixed together in her mind in a scary way. This gave her the idea for The Hunger Games.

simplified: The Life of Pi tells the amazing story of Pi, a young boy from India. His ship sinks and he gets stuck on a small boat in the Pacific Ocean with a dangerous tiger. A Canadian writer named Yann Martel wrote this book. It was his third book and came out in 2001. The book became very popular. More than seven million people bought it around the world. It won many awards and people translated it into 41 different languages. Martel's father worked for the government in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

Complex Document: The Life of Pi tells the extraordinary story of Pi, a teenage boy from India, who is shipwrecked and finds himself trapped in a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a ferocious tiger. It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

simplified: Some bridges fall down and no one knows why at first. Engineers need to study the bridge carefully to find out what happened. Other times, the bridge was made to hold only a certain weight, and something too heavy went on it.

Complex Document: Some bridge collapses are mysteries, and engineers only realise why after they conduct a complete investigation. In other cases, the bridge was designed only to support a certain amount of weight and no more.

simplified: I used to work five days every week. But after my baby was born, I took time off work to care for my baby. When I went back to work, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they go to school. I talked to my boss about this. We decided I would work only three days every week. This means I get much less money now because I work fewer days. But I found a problem! I still have to do the same amount of work as before. Now I do five days of work in only three days, but I get much less money for it!

Complex Document: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it! 
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: I used to work five days every week. But after my baby was born, I took time off work to care for my baby. When I went back to work, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they go to school. I talked to my boss about this. We decided I would work only three days every week. This means I get much less money now because I work fewer days. But I found a problem! I still have to do the same amount of work as before. Now I do five days of work in only three days, but I get much less money for it!

After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it!

simplified: Today, many businesses work with people from other countries. Most business people use English to talk to each other. But different countries have different ways of doing business. If we don't understand these differences, we might think wrong things about people. We might not understand each other well. Here are three important differences in business behavior around the world. These will help you when you work with people from other countries.

Complex Document: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.

simplified: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, we can see early humans making art. For example, they painted pictures on cave walls. But no one knows how this connects to language. Human brains did not get bigger quickly. But humans became smarter and could do more difficult things. Did using language make their brains grow? Or did their better brains start making language? We do not know.

Complex Document: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

simplified: Many big supermarket companies have had problems in the last ten years. People say they have done bad things. They have thrown away lots of food. They have not paid enough money to their suppliers. They have used too much plastic for packaging. This plastic waste is bad for our environment. But now supermarkets are starting to listen. Many people do not like the plastic waste from packaging. So some of the biggest UK supermarkets have made a promise. They will change their packaging. They will use less plastic waste.

Complex Document: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.

Many people do not like the plastic waste from packaging. So some of the biggest UK supermarkets have made a promise. They will change their packaging. They will use less plastic waste.

Customers are angry about the large amounts of plastic waste from packaging. Because of this anger, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have agreed to a plan. They promise to change their packaging and reduce plastic waste.

simplified:
Wasfia Nazreen saw a hula hoop for the first time when she was a young girl. She saw a foreign child playing with one in Bangladesh, her home country. Wasfia could only watch. She could not play with it. In her country, people believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia has climbed the Seven Summits. These are the highest mountains in the world, like Everest and Kilimanjaro. Very few people have climbed all of them. She is the first person to use a hula hoop on each mountain top.

Why did she do this? She wanted to help women and girls in her country. In Bangladesh, women and girls are told they should not do sports. Wasfia wants to change this.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. An A2 level learner can understand short, simple texts containing the highest frequency vocabulary, including a proportion of shared international vocabulary items. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else. 
Complex Document: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport. 
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:
Wasfia Nazreen saw a hula hoop for the first time when she was a young girl. She saw a foreign child playing with one in Bangladesh, her home country. Wasfia could only watch. She could not play with it. In her country, people believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia has climbed the Seven Summits. These are the highest mountains in the world, like Everest and Kilimanjaro. Very few people have climbed all of them. She is the first person to use a hula hoop on each mountain top.

Why did she do this? She wanted to help women and girls in her country. In Bangladesh, women and girls are told they should not do sports. Wasfia wants to change this.

simplified:
When Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl, she saw a hula hoop for the first time. A foreign child who was visiting Bangladesh was playing with it. Wasfia could only watch from far away. In her country, people believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world who has climbed the Seven Summits. These are the highest mountains on each continent, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on top of each mountain. She did this to give power and confidence to women and girls in her country. In Bangladesh, women and girls are often told not to do sports.

Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world who has climbed the Seven Summits. These are the highest mountains on each continent, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. In Bangladesh, women and girls are often told not to do sports.

simplified:
Based on what we found, we think Girox Foods should change how it manages people. The company should care more about its workers. Here are our ideas:

- Give workers more flexible working hours
- Let workers choose where they work from
- Managers should find different ways to challenge their workers
- Give workers more praise and say "thank you" for good work
- Spend more money on training workers, especially training about talking to people from different cultures

These changes will help create a better place to work. When workers are happy, they do their best work.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. An A2 level learner can understand short, simple texts containing the highest frequency vocabulary, including a proportion of shared international vocabulary items. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else. 
Complex Document: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:
Based on what we found, we think Girox Foods should change how it manages people. The company should care more about its workers. Here are our ideas:

- Give workers more flexible working hours
- Let workers choose where they work from
- Managers should find different ways to challenge their workers
- Give workers more praise and say "thank you" for good work
- Spend more money on training workers, especially training about talking to people from different cultures

These changes will help create a better place to work. When workers are happy, they do their best work.

simplified: Based on what we found, we suggest that Girox Foods should focus more on caring for their workers. We should look at ways to give employees more flexible work hours and let them work from places they choose. Managers need to find different ways to give workers interesting tasks and praise them more for their good work. The company should also spend more money on training, especially to help employees communicate better with people from different backgrounds. This will help create a better workplace where employees can do their best work.

simplified: In the last 200 years, better technology and healthcare helped more children live longer. This made the world's population grow very fast. Big families had many children, and these children lived to become adults and have their own children. But in the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. Because of this, women around the world now have fewer babies. Before, women had about six babies each. Now, women have about two babies each.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. An A2 level learner can understand short, simple texts containing the highest frequency vocabulary, including a proportion of shared international vocabulary items. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else. 
Complex Document: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
Simplified Document:

Big families had many children, and these children lived to become adults and have their own children. But in the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. Because of this, women around the world now have fewer babies. Before, women had about six babies each. Now, women have about two babies each.

simplified:
Knowing about different expectations and behaviors can help us avoid misunderstandings. But we must remember that cultural stereotypes can hurt business relationships. 

National cultures may affect how we behave and think. But other things also influence us. These include where we live, our communities, our age, our gender, our company culture, and our personal experiences.

We should keep knowledge about cultural differences in our minds. But we should not use this knowledge to put all people from one country into the same group.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else. 
Complex Document: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:

We should keep knowledge about cultural differences in our minds. But we should not use this knowledge to put all people from one country into the same group.

simplified: Many popular music artists stop making hit songs when they get older. But Springsteen is different. He is in his late 60s and still makes new music that goes to the top of the music charts. He still fills big stadiums with fans. This does not surprise me. Springsteen tells us important stories about our lives. When you listen to his album "Born in the USA," these stories are still important today. They were important before, and they are still important now.

Complex Document: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.

Complex Document: Unlike many other best-selling album artists, Springsteen is still releasing chart-topping, stadium-filling new music and remains at the top of his game in his late 60s. It doesn't surprise me at all. This is a man who tells us our most fundamental stories about ourselves and, when you listen to Born in the USA, those stories are as relevant today as they ever were.

raw_model_output: Unlike many other top-selling music artists, Springsteen is still making popular new music that fills big stadiums. When you listen to his album "Born in the USA," those stories are still important today, just like they were before.

simplified: Scientists want to know more about how genes affect our brain and language. Are there genes that changed and gave humans the ability to speak? Scientists found a gene that changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene seems to help with speaking and how our brain controls our mouth and face. Monkeys have the same gene, but their gene did not change like ours did. We don't know yet how much genes affect language, but maybe one day we will find the answers by studying our DNA.

Complex Document: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.

Scientists found a gene that changed between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene seems to help with speaking and how our brain controls our mouth and face. Monkeys have the same gene, but their gene did not change like ours did. We don't know yet how much genes affect language, but maybe one day we will find the answers by studying our DNA.

simplified: Julie Wong is an important scientist who studies robots and computers. She has written more than 50 research papers that other scientists have read and accepted. She often gives talks at big meetings around the world. In 2012, she won an important prize called the Royal Academy Simone Fielding fellowship. Julie lives with her family in a special house with smart technology that she made herself.
